title: Ruel Wins 2025 VandaÂ &Â YoungÂ Global SongwritingÂ Competition
summary: The Australian singer and songwriter collects first prize and A$50,000 for his song "The Suburbs."
body: Ruel is the winner of the 2025 Vanda & Young Global Songwriting Competition , snagging the lucrative contest for his release â€œThe Suburbs.â€ Written by the Australian singer and songwriter (full name: Ruel Vincent Van Dijk) alongside Mark Landon (M-Phazes), Elias Danielson, Chelsea Lena and Fran Hall, and produced by M-Phazes and Danielson, â€œThe Suburbsâ€ was recognized for its â€œemotional clarity, melodic strength and contemporary songwriting craft,â€ reads a statement from the award organizers. With the victory spoils, Ruel collects A$50,000 ($33,700) courtesy of APRA AMCOS, Alberts and Sony Music Publishing. Ruel broke through in 2018 when he won the ARIA Award for breakthrough artist of the year (now the Michael Gudinski breakthrough artist) with â€œDazed & Confused.â€ He was just 16 at the time, making him the youngest artist to win an ARIA. The following year, he cracked the history books again as the youngest artist to sell out the Sydney Opera Houseâ€™s Concert Hall, twice. He has gone on to amass over three billion streams, sold out multiple tours and regularly attends fashion shows at the invitation of luxury haute coâ€¦

title: Annie Hamilton, Queenie, JJ4K Among Finalists for 2026 APRA Professional DevelopmentÂ Awards
summary: This yearâ€™s recipients will be announced on Thursday, Feb. 12, 2026.
body: Rising pop artist Annie Hamilton, rocker Queenie and hip-hop outfit JJ4K are among the finalists for the 2026 APRA Professional Development Awards (PDAs), a cash-prize presented across 11 categories. An initiative of music rights management organization APRA AMCOS, the PDAs are a leg-up for artists at all stages of their careers, with 13 recipients each taking home A$10,000 ($6,700) to invest in their professional growth, a statement explains. That cash can be used for workshops, courses, composer seminars, co-writing sessions and other development activities, both locally or internationally. An expert panel comprised of more than 50 industry experts select this yearâ€™s finalists, tallying 61 songwriters and composers. Previous PDAs recipients include Angie McMahon, Baker Boy, BARKAA, Gotye, Jem Cassar-Daley, Melanie Dyer, Miss Kaninna, Ngaiire, Rebecca Bracewell, Romy Vager (RVG), Samuel Marks and Yirrmal. This yearâ€™s recipients will be announced on Thursday, Feb. 12, 2026. For more information, visit apraamcos.com.au/professionaldevelopmentawards . The 2026 APRA Professional Development Award finalists are: Classical/Experimental Eduardo Cossio Gabriella Smart Jasmin Wing-Yin Leuâ€¦

title: Fires Erupt in South-Central Chile
summary: Tens of thousands of people fled to safety as blazes spread throughout the countryâ€™s BiobÃ­o and Ã‘uble regions.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Fires Erupt in South-Centralâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us Search January 18, 2026 Wildland fires broke out amid hot and dry conditions in south-central Chile in mid-January 2026, prompting evacuations and causing extensive damage to infrastructure. As of January 20, the spate of deadly fires had burned more than 30,000 hectares (74,000 acres) in the countryâ€™s BiobÃ­o and Ã‘uble regions, according to Chileâ€™s National Forestry Corporation . The MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) instrument on NASAâ€™s Terra satellite captured this image of smoke billowing from multiple fires on January 18. Dozens of active fires in the area prompted the evacuation of 50,000 people and destroyed more than 300 homes, according to a January 19 report from Chileâ€™s U.Nâ€¦

title: Rob Hirst, Midnight Oil Founding Drummer and Songwriter, Dies atÂ 70
summary: â€œAfter fighting heroically for almost three years, Rob is now free of pain," reads a statement from Midnight Oil.
body: SYDNEY, Australia — Tributes are flowing for Rob Hirst , co-founder, co-songwriter and drummer for Midnight Oil , who died Wednesday (Jan. 20) following a years-long battle with cancer . He was 70. Hirst wasnâ€™t just a timekeeper for the Oils, as theyâ€™ve lovingly known in these parts. He was their power station, one of the most formidable and accomplished drummers to emerge from these parts. His solo in â€œPower And the Passion,â€ from 1982, is both powerful, passionate, and one of the most memorable pieces of percussion in Aussie rock music’s impressive history. â€œAfter fighting heroically for almost three years, Rob is now free of pain – â€˜a glimmer of tiny light in the wilderness,â€™â€ reads a statement posted to Midnight Oilâ€™s social pages. â€œHe died peacefully, surrounded by loved ones.â€ A separate message signed by the surviving bandmates — Peter Garrett (vocals), Jim Moginie (guitar, keys) and Martin Rotsey (guitar) — reads: â€œWe are shattered and grieving the loss of our brother Rob. For now there are no words but there will always be songs.â€ Born in Camden, on the outskirts of Sydney, Hirst co-founded the band in early 1970s, initially as Farm. The callâ€¦

title: From Harryâ€™s House to Harryâ€™s â€˜Discoâ€™: Harry Styles Is Back With a New Song & Album to Answer Our PopÂ Prayers
summary: On the new Pop Shop Podcast, Katie & Keith are chatting about what to expect from Styles' fourth album, Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally.
body: Harry Styles is ready to Kiss All the Time (and Disco, Occasionally ) with the release of his fourth studio album, announced last week — and we’re hoping he’s also ready to answer all our pop prayers. Related The Longest-Leading Billboard Hot 100 No. 1s Harry Styles Announces First Single From New Album: Here’s When ‘Aperture’ Arrives Harry Styles Quietly Releases Surprise ‘Forever, Forever’ Music Video On the new Billboard Pop Shop Podcast , Katie & Keith are talking about the March 6 album and its lead single “Aperture,” arriving Thursday. Might Styles pop up on the Grammys on Feb. 1 to perform and promote the project? And can we expect the sort of out-of-the-gate success he found on his previous album Harry’s House with the 15-week Billboard Hot 100 No. 1 lead single “As It Was”? Listen to the full discussion below: Also on the show, weâ€™ve got chart news on how Zach Bryanâ€™s new album With Heaven On Top debuts atop the Billboard 200, while Bruno Marsâ€™ latest single “I Just Might” opens at No. 1 on the Hot 100. Plus, buzzy singer Sienna Spiro scores her first top 40 hit on the â€¦

title: Meghan Trainor Welcomes Third Child With Daryl Sabara â€˜Thanks to Our Incredible, Superwoman Surrogateâ€™
summary: Baby girl Mikey Moon Trainor was born on Sunday.
body: Meghan Trainor announced Tuesday (Jan. 20) that she and husband Daryl Sabara welcomed a third child over the weekend: baby girl Mikey Moon Trainor. According to the couple’s Instagram post, Mikey Moon was born on Sunday (Jan. 18) “thanks to our incredible, superwoman surrogate.” Related Meghan Trainor Enters the Chat on Ashley Tisdale & Hilary Duff Mom Group Drama With Cheeky Video: ‘Still Don’t Care’ Meghan Trainor Announces New Album ‘Toy With Me,’ Drops First Single Dedicated to ‘Anyone Whoâ€™s Ever Felt Judged’ JhenÃ© Aiko & Meghan Trainor Join ‘Hey A.J.!,’ New Disney Jr. Animated Series Inspired by a Super Bowl Champ “We are forever grateful to all the doctors, nurses, teams who made this dream possible,” the couple wrote alongside a carousel of seven photos, starting with a teary-eyed Trainor holding her newborn daughter. “We had endless conversations with our doctors in this journey and this was the safest way for us to be able to continue growing our family. We are over the moon in love with this precious girl.” A second photo shows Trainor’s two older â€¦

title: Billboardâ€™s Music Industry EventsÂ Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. title: The Founders of Brooklynâ€™s Newest Club Refuge Say Every Weekend, Its Hi-Def Soundsystem â€˜Sounds a Little Better Than the WeekendÂ Beforeâ€™
summary: "Refuge is for people who are tired of the free-for-all warehouses and the commercial nightlife circuit," say John Dimatteo and Craig "Shorty" Bernabeu.
body: When John Dimatteo and Craig “Shorty” Bernabeu announced the opening of a new nightclub in Brooklyn last August, they promised nothing less than a “sanctuary for electronic music,” which is why they called their space Refuge. Set inside a standalone 19th-century industrial complex between East Williamsburg and Bushwick, the 3,200 square-foot, 500-capacity club is built around a meticulously crafted high-definition soundsystem that serves as Refuge’s literal and figurative beating heart. The system was designed by Bernabeu, who’s been building such soundsystems for more than 20 years, most notably at New York clubs including Nowadays and Analog BKNY and the legendary Stereo Montreal. Dimatteo, meanwhile, is a longtime New York promoter and event producer. Since the pair opened the doors of Refuge this past September, the space has hosted sets from a crew of heavyhitting artists including Floorplan, DJ Seinfeld, Kenny Larkin, Sasha and Victor Calderone, the latter two of whom played sets on New Years Eve and New Year’s Day, respectively. And with Refuge now entering its fourth month, Dimatteo and Bernabeu say they’ll soon unveil daytimâ€¦

summary: The British and Irish Lions will play three Tests in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch on their landmark first women's tour to New Zealand.

title: Women coaches 'twice as likely to be bullied', study finds
summary: Women who coach sports in the UK are experiencing bullying and harassment at far higher rates than men, according to a new study.

title: 'Tears in my eyes' - Jesus enjoys 'dream night' in San Siro
summary: Gabriel Jesus says he had "tears in my eyes" after scoring twice to help Arsenal win 3-1 at Inter Milan for a seventh successive win in the Champions League.

title: Arsenal depth of quality 'incredible' - Arteta
summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta was delighted with Gabriel Jesus's display and two goals in the 3-1 Champions League win at Inter Milan, showing the "incredible" depth of quality in his squad.

title: Salford edge Swindon to set up Man City FA Cup tie
summary: Luke Garbutt scores a sublime free-kick as Salford beat Swindon 3-2 in the FA Cup third round to set up a glamour tie with seven-time winners Manchester City.

title: Villa interested in Mateta - Wednesday's gossip
summary: Aston Villa explore Jean-Philippe Mateta and Tammy Abraham moves, Manchester United decline Ajax's Manuel Ugarte approach and Bournemouth fight to keep Marcos Senesi.

title: NASAâ€™s Day of Remembrance Honors Fallen Heroes of Exploration
summary: NASA will observe its annual Day of Remembrance on Thursday, Jan. 22, which includes commemorating the crews of Apollo 1 and the space shuttles Challenger and Columbia. The event is traditionally held every year on the fourth Thursday of January, as all three astronaut accidents happened around theâ€¦
body: The Space Shuttle Columbia Memorial is seen during a wreath laying ceremony that was part of NASA’s Day of Remembrance, Thursday, Jan. 23, 2025, at Arlington National Cemetery in Virginia. Wreaths were laid in memory of those men and women who lost their lives in the quest for space exploration. Credit: NASA/Bill Ingalls NASA will observe its annual Day of Remembrance on Thursday, Jan. 22, which includes commemorating the crews of Apollo 1 and the space shuttles Challenger and Columbia. The event is traditionally held every year on the fourth Thursday of January, as all three astronaut accidents happened around the end of the month. â€œOn NASAâ€™s Day of Remembrance, we pause to honor the members of the NASA family who lost their lives while pushing the boundaries of exploration and discovery,â€ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. â€œWe remember them not to retreat from risk, but to respect it â€” to learn, to improve, and continue onward. Their sacrifice and the strength of their families will forever inspire us as we continue to reach for the stars and pursue the secrets of the universe.â€ Isaacman will lead an observance at 1 p.m. EST at Arlington National Cemetery in Virginia,â€¦

title: Frank on how he is managing the pressure at Spurs
summary: Thomas Frank feels his Tottenham Hotspur side are getting better and that he deserves patience following their two goal win over 10-man Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League.

title: Kim Petras Issues Public Plea to Be â€˜Droppedâ€™ From Her Label After Receiving â€˜No Supportâ€™ forÂ Months
summary: The singer is currently signed to Republic Records.
body: Kim Petras wants out of her record deal with Republic Records, with the pop star unleashing a series of posts on X explaining why she’d rather be an independent artist going forward. On Tuesday (Jan. 20), Petras wrote bluntly, “Iâ€™m tired of having no control over my own life or career.” Related Kim Petras & The Chainsmokers ‘Show You How It’s Done’ on New Song ‘Don’t Lie’: Watch the Video Kim Petras Encourages Fans to ‘Accept Yourself’ This Pride Season â€” But Only on Their Own Terms REPUBLIC Collective Dominates 2025 Year-End Label Charts “I want to continue to self fund and self curate my own music,” she continued. “This is why I have formally requested to be dropped @RepublicRecords.” In another post , the German-born musician alleged that her label has “refused” to set a release date for her next album, Detour — which Petras wrote has “been done for 6 months” — and has also not yet paid her collaborators for their work on the record. She also added, “I won a grammy 2 years agoâ€¦â€¦.. the music is TEA. Still no support. If itâ€™s not aâ€¦

title: Lizzo to Perform Music & Comedy Set at Netflix Is a Joke Fest in Los Angeles: â€˜I Got Everybody & They Mama on ThisÂ Showâ€™
summary: Netflix Is a Joke Fest is set for May 4 through May 10 with appearances from Pete Davidson, Kevin Hart, Adam Sandler and Jelly Roll.
body: In comedy, the truth hurts — and Lizzo is hosting a showcase for the Netflix Is a Joke Fest in May, which will see her deliver a special set combining her musical and comical talents into a unique performance. “I Got everybody & they mama on this show @netflixisajoke takes over Los Angeles May 4â€“10 Tickets on sale Friday, Jan 23rd @ 10AM PT,” Lizzo wrote on Instagram on Tuesday (Jan. 20). Related Lizzo Reflects on What She’s Learned From Being ‘Canceled’ Numerous Times in New Essay: ‘F–k It’ Lizzo Says ‘Congrats’ to ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ on Grammy Noms With Cover of ‘Golden (Flute Version)’ Lizzo Performs Live Debut of ‘IRL’ With SZA in Paris: ‘Thanks for Letting Me Throw It Byke on Ur Stage’ It’s all going down the week of May 4 through May 10, as a star-studded lineup of acts will take over 35 different L.A. venues, including the Hollywood Bowl, The Greek Theatre and the Intuit Dome. Smaller comedy staples like The Comedy Store, Laugh Factory and Hollywood IMPROV are also part of the rotation. Other musical acts slated to be involved include Jelly â€¦

title: Waugh invests in European T20 Premier League
summary: Ex-Australia captain Steve Waugh is among the franchise investors in a men's European T20 tournament, set to be played in Ireland, Scotland and the Netherlands later this year featuring Steve Smith and Mitch Marsh.

title: 'Battered in Bodo' - is this more than just a blip for Man City?
summary: Manchester City suffered their very own "hell of a beating" moment in Norway on Tuesday - now Pep Guardiola and his players must turn around their fortunes in an increasingly trying January.

title: NASA Astronaut Suni Williams Retires
summary: After 27 years of service, NASA astronaut Suni Williams retired from the agency, effective Dec. 27, 2025. Williams completed three missions aboard the International Space Station, setting numerous human spaceflight records throughout her career. â€œSuni Williams has been a trailblazer in human spacefâ€¦
body: NASA astronaut Suni Williams at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station’s Naval Ordnance Test Unit basin in Florida on March 28, 2018. Credit: NASA/Kim Shiflett After 27 years of service, NASA astronaut Suni Williams retired from the agency, effective Dec. 27, 2025. Williams completed three missions aboard the International Space Station, setting numerous human spaceflight records throughout her career. â€œSuni Williams has been a trailblazer in human spaceflight, shaping the future of exploration through her leadership aboard the space station and paving the way for commercial missions to low Earth orbit,â€ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. â€œHer work advancing science and technology has laid the foundation for Artemis missions to the Moon and advancing toward Mars, and her extraordinary achievements will continue to inspire generations to dream big and push the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible. Congratulations on your well-deserved retirement, and thank you for your service to NASA and our nation.â€ Williams logged 608 days in space â€” second on the list of cumulative time in space by a NASA astronaut. She ranks sixth on the list of longest single spaceflight by an American, tiâ€¦

title: Carrick win Shield for first time in 33 years
summary: Carrick Rangers win the County Antrim Shield for the first time in 33 years with a 4-2 shootout win over Cliftonville after a 1-1 draw at Seaview.

title: 'Everything is going wrong' - Guardiola on Bodo/Glimt upset
summary: Pep Guardiola responds to his team's second defeat in four days as Manchester City lose at Bodo/Glimt in the Champions League.

title: Slot hints Salah will start for Liverpool in Marseille
summary: Arne Slot suggests Mohamed Salah will return to the Liverpool starting line-up against Marseille in Wednesday's Champions League tie, insisting his relationship with the forward is "as normal as it's always been".

title: Littler beats Van Gerwen to win Saudi Masters
summary: Luke Littler wins the inaugural Saudi Arabia Darts Masters with an emphatic 8-5 victory over Michael van Gerwen in Riyadh.

title: NASAÂ Chase Aircraft EnsuresÂ X-59â€™sÂ SafetyÂ in Flight
summary: As NASAâ€™s X-59 quiet supersonic research aircraft continues a series of flight tests over the California high desert in 2026, its pilot will be flying with a buddy closely looking out for his safety. That colleague will be another test pilot in a separate chase aircraft. His job as chase pilot: keeâ€¦
body: 5 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) NASAâ€™s X-59 quiet supersonic research aircraft flies above Palmdale and Edwards, California, during its first flight Oct. 28, 2025, accompanied by a NASA F/A-18 research aircraft serving as chase. NASA/Jim Ross As NASAâ€™s  X-59 quiet supersonic research aircraft  continues a series of flight tests over the California high desert in 2026, its pilot will be flying with a buddy closely looking out for his safety.  That colleague will be another test pilot in a separate chase aircraft. His job as chase pilot: keep a careful watch on things as he tracks the X-59 through the sky, providing an extra set of eyes to help ensure the flight tests are as safe as possible.  Having a chase pilot watch to make sure operations are going smoothly is an essential task when an experimental aircraft is exercising its capabilities for the first time. The chase pilot also takes on tasks like monitoring local weather and supplementing communications between the X-59 and air traffic control.  â€œAll this helps reduce theâ€¦

Payload deployment, which begins approximately five hours after launch, is controlled by the avionics unit. Image Credit: NASA/Kevin Oâ€™Brien

title: Hubble Nets Menagerie of Young Stellar Objects
summary: A disparate collection of young stellar objects bejewels a cosmic panorama in the star-forming region NGC 1333 in this new image from NASAâ€™s Hubble Space Telescope. To the left, an actively forming star called a protostar casts its glow on the surrounding gas and dust, creating a reflection nebula.â€¦
body: A bright reflection nebula shares the stage with a protostar and planet-forming disk in this Hubble image. NASA, ESA, K. Stapelfeldt (Jet Propulsion Laboratory) and D. Watson (University of Rochester); Processing: Gladys Kober (NASA/Catholic University of America) A disparate collection of young stellar objects bejewels a cosmic panorama in the star-forming region NGC 1333 in this new image from NASAâ€™s  Hubble Space Telescope . To the left, an actively forming star called a protostar casts its glow on the surrounding gas and dust, creating a reflection nebula. Two dark stripes on opposite sides of the bright point (upper left) are its protoplanetary disk, a region where planets could form, and the diskâ€™s shadow, cast across the large envelope of material around the star. Material accumulates onto the protostar through this rotating disk of gas and dust, a product of the collapsing cloud of gas and dust that gave birth to the star. Where the shadow stops and the disk begins is presently unknown. To the center right, an outflow cavity reveals a fan-shaped reflection nebula. The two stars at its base, HBC 340 (lower) and HBC 341 (upper), unleash stellar winds, or material flowinâ€¦
